intro: Himeranthus ameghinoi, commonly known as the Argentine flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange petals and velvety leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
